head.citation-title: Damage assessment of diversion tunnel bored underneath existing MRT subway in Bangkok
head.abstracts: The tunnelling construction in Bangkok is more and more complicated. Unfortunately, monitoring in the vacant tunnel is inapplicable as most tunnels are constructed for the Metropolitan Water Network. Hence, close investigation of any deformation in the tunnel has not been carried out and only ground surface settlement at the intersection between existing water supply tunnel and underneath tunnel was monitored in previous projects. This paper presents a study of the deformation of the existing MRT subway tunnel during the construction of new underneath diversion tunnels. Three test sections with full instrumentation scheme were carried out to setting the tunnel parameters and evaluate the performance of the tunnelling works as well as compare the measured field data with prediction by Finite Element Method. Lining deformation of the existing MRT subway tunnel is discussed in connection with the performance of TBM operation, including face pressure, advance rate, grout pressure and volume loss.
